awd_titl_txt: Superfluid Helium Three and Disordered Materials at         Ultralow Temperatures
awd_abstract_narration: They propose to measure the absolute thermodynamic phase diagram                of superfluid Helium three, focusing principally upon the                       magnetic field and pressure dependences of the transition between               the superfluid A and B phases.  From this measurement they will                 be able to extract thermodynamic as well as microscopic data on                 the superfluid which has been unavailable to date.                                                                                                              They further propose to continue measurements already in progress               studying the limits to superflow in superfluid Helium three                     caused by textural transitions in unrestricted geometries.                                                                                                      Finally they propose to continue their study of the                             thermalization rate of electrons taken out of equilibrium in two                dimensional conducting systems at ultralow temperatures.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
